title: FCC filings reveal Apple’s mysterious ‘Network Adapter’ that runs iOS
content:
Every time a company builds a product with radio frequency (like Bluetooth or Wi-Fi), it must be approved by regulatory agencies like FCC. Interestingly, new FCC filings this week reveal a mysterious new “Network Adapter” from Apple that runs iOS.

more…

The post FCC filings reveal Apple’s mysterious ‘Network Adapter’ that runs iOS appeared first on 9to5Mac.
description: Every time a company builds a product with radio frequency (like Bluetooth or Wi-Fi), it must be approved by regulatory agencies like FCC. Interestingly, new FCC filings this week reveal a mysterious new “Network Adapter” from Apple that runs iOS. Codenamed “A2657,” the product is simply described as a “Network Adapter.” According to documents shared […]
